name: PixelFem #66 - Malala Yousafzai
description:
When BBC Urdu asked Malala Yousafzai’s father if one of his students would blog about life under the local Taliban, his daughter took on the task. Her first post was published under the pen name Gul Makai (“cornflower”) on Jan. 3, 2009. She was 11 years old. Over the next three years, Yousafzai wrote about her life and her desire to get an education, in a region where girls’ schools were being shuttered and bombed. Yousafzai sets an amazing example of bravery in daring to raise her voice on behalf of others and reminds us of our obligation to follow her example—to be vigilant in the protection of basic human rights, whatever our age, whatever our circumstance.

✺This work is part of PixelFems, an evolving project on the Tezos blockchain celebrating iconic women from the past and present✺
